isis.stitle: CAB: 5000i AND 9000i CONVENTIONAL - INSTALL - CAB AIR SUSPENSION SYSTEM FOR 5000i SERIES AFTER FEBRUARY 2001

svcproc.title: CAB AIR SUSPENSION SYSTEM FOR 5000 i SERIES AFTER FEBRUARY 2001

svcprocinfo.para: Refer to Figure 122 for Items in parentheses.

The cab air suspension system for the 5000 i Series after February 2001 contains two air springs (bags) (Item 1), two shock absorbers (Item 2), and is controlled by the height control valve (Item 3). The air suspension assembly (Figure 122) needs no lubrication and very little maintenance.

The following components - air lines (to air spring) (Item 4), elbow fittings (Item 6), tee fitting (Item 7), air springs (bags) (Item 1), height control valve (Item 3), shock absorbers (Item 2) and lateral control arm (Item 24) - should be checked at the time the vehicle is being serviced. Immediate corrective action should be taken if a malfunction occurs.

note.para: The height control valve (Item 3), air springs (bags) (Item 1) and shock absorbers (Item 2) are serviceable and can be replaced individually.

svcprocinfo.para:
Periodically check tightness of all fasteners and air line fitting connections. Refer to the
TORQUE CHART
for (Figure 122) for proper tightening of all fasteners and air line fitting connections.

warning.para: To avoid personal injury, whenever any component is serviced or installed onto the air system, be sure to set parking brake and/or block vehicle wheels to prevent it from moving while service is being performed.

svcsubproc.title: Install Height Control Valve

note.para: If there is an attempt to disassemble or adjust fittings on the height control valve (Item 3, Figure 122) , it will void the warranty. Contact the air suspension manufacturer for assistance.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 121 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Inspect height control valve (Item 3) to insure drive bearing notch (Item 7) is located on "SUSP" port side of valve. If not, loosen pan head bearing screw (Item 8), but not remove, and pull height control valve lever (Item 6) loose from drive bearing (Item 9) and rotate drive bearing until drive bearing notch is in correct position, then secure height control valve lever by tightening pan head bearing screw. Tighten to 40 to 50 Lbf-in (4.5 to 5.6 N•m).

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 122 for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step1.para: Position height control valve (Item 3) in place on suspension crossmember bracket (Item 30) and install two hex head bolts (Item 8) thru height control valve and suspension crossmember bracket and install hex lock nuts (Item 9). Tighten to 8 to 10 Lbf-ft (11 to 14 N•m).

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 121 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Install height control valve linkage (Item 5) onto threaded ball pivot of height control valve lever (Item 6) by positioning the height control valve linkage socket over threaded ball pivot and pushing linkage socket onto threaded ball pivot until it snaps in place, latch the linkage clip.

Push air line (supply) (Item 1) into "SUPPLY" port of height control valve (Item 3). Refer to
TORQUE CHART
for proper tightening of air line fittings.

Push air line (to air spring) (Item 2) from driver side air spring (bag) (Item 1) into compression nut (Item 4) of push to connect tee fitting (Item 12) in "SUSP" port of height control valve (Item 3) and tighten. Refer to
TORQUE CHART
for proper tightening of air line fittings.

Push air line (to air spring) (Item 2) from passenger side air spring (bag) (Item 1) into other compression nut (Item 4) of push to connect tee fitting (Item 12) in "SUSP" port of height control valve (Item 3) and tighten. Refer to
TORQUE CHART
for proper tightening of air line fittings.
Build up air pressure and check for air leaks.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 122 for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step1.para:
Check cab ride height between bottom of left and right cab mount plate (Items 22 and 23) and top of suspension crossmember bracket (Item 30). Cab air suspension ride height is 4 1/2 inches (114.3 mm) (Figure 180) . If adjustment is required, refer to ADJUSTMENTS,
CAB AIR SUSPENSION SYSTEM FOR 5000 i SERIES AFTER FEBRUARY 2001
.

svcsubproc.title: Install Cab Air Suspension Shock Absorber
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 122 for Items in parentheses.

note.para: Shock Absorber mounting bolts (Item 10 and 12) are reversed so that they are installed from the front instead of from the rear of the air suspension system on vehicles built after February 2001.

step1.para: Position one shock absorber (Item 2) in place between left cab mount plate (Item 22) and suspension crossmember bracket (Item 30).

Install hex head bolt (Item 12) from the front thru mounting bracket of suspension crossmember bracket (Item 30) and the bottom of shock absorber (Item 2) and install hex lock nut (Item 11). Tighten to 45 Lbf-ft (61 N•m).
Install hex head bolt (Item 10) from the front thru left cab mount plate (Item 22) and the top of shock absorber (Item 2) and install hex lock nut (Item 11). Tighten to 45 Lbf-ft (61 N•m).
Position one shock absorber (Item 2) in place between right cab mount plate (Item 23) and suspension crossmember bracket (Item 30).

Install hex head bolt (Item 12) from the front thru mounting bracket of suspension crossmember bracket (Item 30) and the bottom of shock absorber (Item 2) and install hex lock nut (Item 11). Tighten to 45 Lbf-ft (61 N•m).
Install hex head bolt (Item 10) from the front thru right cab mount plate (Item 23) and the top of shock absorber (Item 2) and install hex lock nut (Item 11). Tighten to 45 Lbf-ft (61 N•m).

svcsubproc.title: Install Cab Air Suspension Air Spring (Bag)
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 122 for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step1.para: Position one air spring (bag) (Item 1) at threaded stud on left cab mount plate (Item 22), then screw it on until top of air spring (bag) is tight against left cab mount plate.
Position one air spring (bag) (Item 1) at threaded stud on right cab mount plate (Item 23), then screw it on until top of air spring (bag) is tight against right cab mount plate.

Release jack placed between frame rail flange and back of cab floor frame (Figure 106) , lower cab, making sure bottom threaded studs of both air springs (bags) (Item 1) are positioned into mounting holes of suspension crossmember bracket (Item 30).
Install jam nut (Item 20) at the bottom of both air springs (bags) (Item 1) securing air springs (bags) to suspension crossmember bracket (Item 30). Tighten to 30 Lbf-ft (41 N•m).

Push push to connect elbow fitting (Item 6) into the bottom of each air spring (bag) (Item 1) and make sure they connect properly. Refer to
TORQUE CHART
for proper tightening of air line fittings.

Push air line (Item 4) into compression nut of push to connect elbow fitting (Item 6) at the bottom of driver side air spring (bag) (Item 1) and tighten. Refer to
TORQUE CHART
for proper tightening of air line fittings.

Push air line (Item 4) into compression nut of push to connect elbow fitting (Item 6) at the bottom of passenger side air spring (bag) (Item 1) and tighten. Refer to
TORQUE CHART
for proper tightening of air line fittings.
Build up air pressure and check for air spring operation. Also check for air leaks. Correct as necessary.

Check cab ride height between bottom of left and right cab mount plate (Items 22 and 23) and top of suspension crossmember bracket (Item 30). Cab air suspension ride height is 4 1/2 inches (114.3 mm) (Figure 180) . If adjustment is required, refer to ADJUSTMENTS,
CAB AIR SUSPENSION SYSTEM FOR 5000 i SERIES AFTER FEBRUARY 2001
.

svcsubproc.title: Install Lateral Control Rod
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 122 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Install lateral control rod (Item 24) as follows.

step2.para: Position lateral control rod (Item 24) in mounting bracket of suspension crossmember bracket (Item 30) and install hex head bolt (Item 15) from the rear thru mounting bracket of suspension crossmember bracket and lateral control rod (Item 24) and install hex lock nut (Item 16). Tighten to 40 to 45 Lbf-ft (54 to 61 N•m).

Position lateral control rod (Item 24) in mounting bracket of left cab mount plate (Item 22) and install hex head bolt (Item 13) from the rear thru mounting bracket of cab mount plate and lateral control rod and install hex lock nut (Item 14). Tighten to 40 to 45 Lbf-ft (54 to 61 N•m).
